title: Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Delhi Cantonment)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward interview. I was interviewed by a four-member panel, and the conversation was divided into experience sharing, situational analysis, and policy knowledge. appreciated the gender diversity on the panel
Interview Questions: past experience and how it relates to the job profile

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Must submit required documents with methodology note and financial bid. Based on shortlisting of CV, a technical note and financial bid, selected candidates are called for an interview. The interview lasts around 20 to 40 minutes, largely on technical knowledge with some experiences of working in the field or with the government
Interview Questions: Q What are the challenges for girls education in Rajasthan and how a programme can address them Q Reflect on an example where I found difficult to achieve the result and how I managed that situation

title: Project Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New Delhi)
Interview Descriptions: As usual telephonic Interview is organized by HR, and  interview board is composed of 4-5 members including  Head of Office/Regional Office, Program Officer, sister UN organization representative, Technical Expert, Communication Officer(optional) & HR support officer.
Interview Questions: In general interview atmosphere is very cordial. They try to understand your work experience, and try to understand how you handled a situation that the organization faces while working in the field. Your operation skill, managerial skill, UNICEF branding and team building capacity is judged through various questions, queries and situational analysis type of question. It varies from 40-60 minutes approx.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Written and panel nterviews.Written was to be submitted through a computer test. Subject matter experts took the thematic interviews. The writte  npapaer was analytical and presentation type. Interviews were virtual and brief.
Interview Questions: How would you strategise the malnutrition reduction if the district

title: Marketing Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (New Delhi)
Interview Descriptions: Structured, formal interview. Not much conversation, strictly business. There were people from the team and one from HR at the panel interview. Why do you want to work for us. Some questions specific to the role.
Interview Questions: Why UNICEF? Why should we choose you?

title: District Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UNICEF (Rānchī) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Question releated to development sector was asked
Interview panel has 5 member
Interview was conducted in the college. 
There were only one round of interview. 
Ques releated to social mobilization. 
Why to join development
Communication for development
Interview Questions:
About social marketing
Social mobilization activities
Communication for development

title: Administrative Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNICEF (New Delhi)
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with two managers, it went quite well. After a week I reach out to them and they said that I was the most promising candidate that they have and will discuss the role further with me. And ultimately end up ghosting me after several efforts. Says alot of the people and culture of UNICEF India.
Interview Questions: Situational base questions.

title: Education Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions:
Step 1: Written test
Step 2: Skype interview
Step 3: Certificates checked in person
Step 4: Offer
(Step 1 was in Jan- offer received in May)

The interview was technical. Panel of 3 people. 2 people from the technical field 1 person from HR.
Interview Questions:
Relevance of RTE
Experience of managing teams
Experience of mitigating field challenges
And other competency based Qs

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNICEF (Bhopal) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a positive experience overall. I did not know answers to most questions, but I got selected based on attitude and confidence.  The interviewer was calm, didnt bethay emotions in her voice.
Interview Questions: What are SDG? What is a social indicator? Etc.

title: Intern - Monthly Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly easy. Just a bunch of questions on why I would like to join and how I would contribute. I ended up interning for two months. Also, it's helpful to know what UNICEF works for and their long term vision.
Interview Questions: Why UNICEF

title: Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNICEF in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Topic sentences are similar to mini thesis statements. Like a thesis statement, a topic sentence has a specific main point. Whereas the thesis is the main point of the essay, the topic sentence is the main point of the paragraph. Like the thesis statement, a topic sentence has a unifying function. But a thesis statement or topic sentence alone doesn’t guarantee unity. An essay is unified if all the paragraphs relate to the thesis, whereas a paragraph is unified if all the sentences relate to the topic sentence. Note: Not all paragraphs need topic sentences. In particular, opening and closing paragraphs, which serve different functions from body paragraphs, generally don’t have topic sentences.
Interview Questions: Topic sentences are similar to mini thesis statements. Like a thesis statement, a topic sentence has a specific main point. Whereas the thesis is the main point of the essay, the topic sentence is the main point of the paragraph. Like the thesis statement, a topic sentence has a unifying function. But a thesis statement or topic sentence alone doesn’t guarantee unity. An essay is unified if all the paragraphs relate to the thesis, whereas a paragraph is unified if all the sentences relate to the topic sentence. Note: Not all paragraphs need topic sentences. In particular, opening and closing paragraphs, which serve different functions from body paragraphs, generally don’t have topic sentences.

title: Independent Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UNICEF (Lucknow) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a group discussion with senior unicef consultants,govt. officers and independent NGOS members regarding experience in child rights,mental health,child care institutions etc.The discussion was very cordial and enriching.it lasted around more than one hour.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your work experience.

title: Sales and Applications Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNICEF (Calcutta) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: worst interview process ever. they started with group discussion , at a time 25 candidate attend the GD , it was look like a fish market.. the interviewer was busy with phone, he didn't concentrate on GD. after completing GD they declare the shortlisted candidate, they shortlisted those candidate who was silent but how they did it.. that was most third class interview i have seen ever.
Interview Questions: GD on Demonetization

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNICEF
Interview Descriptions: Cleared aptitude test and technical test easily and then was called for technical test. Successfully cleared the technical test and was selected for HR round and then was asked for filling out the feedback form and when filled the feedback form and was waiting for HR interview. Got to know that I got rejected without being interviewed in HR round.
Interview Questions: Questions were average and only asked from your technical test.

title: GSA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New Delhi) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a lengthy hiring process spanning 6 months, which began in September and Letter of Intent being sent in March. Which included 1 Written Test, 1 HR round, and Final Issuance and Acceptance of Job Offer
Interview Questions:
A. HR - Introduction about myself  and What makes me fit for the role applied?
B Manager - 2 Situation based Queries, 2 Analytical Questions, 1 Logical Reasoning 
C. HR - Asked me if I have any questions for them.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (New Delhi)
Interview Descriptions: There were three rounds and it was a very difficult interview. They asked questions from academics and proffesional course done. It was not a stress type of interview and they made me quite comfortable and allowed me to relax. They kind of do some phychoanalysis also i guess.
Interview Questions: high salary or work satisfaction. Your priority

title: Social Work Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNICEF (Bengaluru) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was called to attend a workshop where i had to help them out and then they asked me whether i would like this type of job. and i said yes. so they called me to join my work on 01st of May 2012 at M. S. Building, Bangalore. They said they would look after my stay and would case for the pick up from the stop i get down. For the salary first they said they would give 8000 and then they said they would give Rs. 10,000 per month including CTC.
Interview Questions: Would you like to work in Bangalore?

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New Delhi) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was very smooth I enjoyed the written test and discussions with the panel it was very nice discussing my profile with them
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Operations Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNICEF (New Delhi) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Since the post was advertised internally, we were well notified in advanced through internal memos and to other UN agencies also as per the Un norms.
The interview panel was very well constituted , representing HR, Staff Union, subject expert, the reporting officer to who the candidate will be reporting on selection for the post.
Enough time is given to the candidate, and the team ensures that the candidate is relaxed and comfortable right from the time of entry into the interview hall.
Interview Questions:
Questions are very relevant to the post . So if a candidate has really applied himself to any situation , should be able to answer the questions. 
Some technical questions , when unable to answer, one should be honest to declare his/her inability to answer.
Generally there are are technical questions on the subject and also one or two competency based questions. 
The competencies are already given in the job advertisement and one need to appraise himself/herself of the competencies in advance.

title: State Consultant Nutrition Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNICEF (Jaipur, Rajasthan) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Be fully prepared for the interview
Interview Questions: How will you improve the status of Malnutrition in State?

title: Operations Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNICEF (New Delhi) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: The interview was nice and cordial. They tested me online first and then the results came and i was selected for the secodn round of interview whereby i was asked for a telecon interview. I passed that test too. Then i was called for a personal interview which i passed too. and then they said we will have a final round of interview which had 10 people in the panel.
Interview Questions: Difficluties in past job
